versos: (giant) 1 Samuel 17:4 - "A champion named Goliath, who was from Gath, came out of the Philistine camp. He was over nine feet tall.";;;
(goeth) Psalm 58:1 - "Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.";;;
(fortress) Psalm 91:2 - "I will say of the Lord, 'He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.'";;;
(waves) Matthew 8:24 - "Suddenly a furious storm came up on the lake, so that the waves swept over the boat. But Jesus was sleeping.";;;
(ungodly) Psalm 1:6 - "For the Lord watches over the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked leads to destruction.";;;
(haughty) Proverbs 21:4 - "haughty eyes and a proud heart the unplowed field of the wickedproduce sin.";;;
(buckler) Psalm 18:2 - The LORD is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.;;;
(hinds) "God, the Lord, is my strength; he makes my feet like the deer's; he makes me tread on my high places." - Habakkuk 3:19;;;
(teacheth) Psalm 25:9 - "The meek will he guide in judgment: and the meek will he teach his way.";;;

(mire) "I waited patiently for the Lord; he turned to me and heard my cry. He lifted me out of the slimy pit, out of the mud and mire; he set my feet on a rock and gave me a firm place to stand." - Psalm 40:1-2;;;
(violent) Matthew 11:12 - "From the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven has suffered violence, and the violent take it by force.";;;
(ruleth) "And he shall rule them with a rod of iron; as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to shivers: even as I received of my Father." - Revelation 2:27;;;
(wool) Isaiah 1:18 - "Though your sins are like scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they are red as crimson, they shall be like wool.";;;
(oreb) Job 38:41 - Who provides for the raven its prey
(shining) Proverbs 4:18 - "The path of the righteous is like the morning sun, shining ever brighter till the full light of day.";;;

(adam) Genesis 2:19 - "Now out of the ground the Lord God had formed every beast of the field and every bird of the heavens and brought them to the man to see what he would call them. And whatever the man called every living creature, that was its name.";;;

(araunah) 2 Samuel 24:23 - "But araunah said to David, 'Let my lord the king take whatever he wishes and offer it up. Here are oxen for the burnt offering, and here are threshing sledges and ox yokes for the wood.'";;;
